publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-209# Alex Fergusson: South West Transport Links—That the Parliament welcomes Stena Sealink’s recent decision to create 20 new jobs by substantially increasing its investment in the Loch Ryan to Northern Ireland ferry route, and calls upon the Executive to match that commitment by announcing significant road improvement schemes for the A75 and A77 trunk routes to Stranraer.

S1M-209# Alex Fergusson: South West Transport Links—That the Parliament welcomes Stena Sealink’s recent decision to create 20 new jobs by substantially increasing its investment in the Loch Ryan to Northern Ireland ferry route, and calls upon the Executive to match that commitment by announcing significant road improvement schemes for the A75 and A77 trunk routes to Stranraer.
S1M-209# South West Transport Links (lodged on 15 October 1999) David Mundell*
S1M-209# South West Transport Links (lodged on 15 October 1999) Alasdair Morgan*, Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-209# Alex Fergusson: South West Transport Links—That the Parliament welcomes Stena Sealink’s recent decision to create 20 new jobs by substantially increasing its investment in the Loch Ryan to Northern Ireland ferry route, and calls upon the Executive to match that commitment by announcing significant road improvement schemes for the A75 and A77 trunk routes to Stranraer. Supported by: David Mundell, Alasdair Morgan, Cathy Jamieson, Phil Gallie*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-209# South West Transport Links (lodged on 15 October 1999) Christine Grahame*

S1M-209# Alex Fergusson: South West Transport Links—That the Parliament welcomes Stena Sealink’s recent decision to create 20 new jobs by substantially increasing its investment in the Loch Ryan to Northern Ireland ferry route, and calls upon the Executive to match that commitment by announcing significant road improvement schemes for the A75 and A77 trunk routes to Stranraer. Supported by: David Mundell, Alasdair Morgan, Cathy Jamieson, Phil Gallie, Mr Adam Ingram, Christine Grahame
S1M-209# South West Transport Links (lodged on 15 October 1999) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-209# South West Transport Links (lodged on 15 October 1999) Mr Murray Tosh*

S1M-209# Alex Fergusson: South West Transport Links-That the Parliament welcomes Stena Sealink's recent decision to create 20 new jobs by substantially increasing its investment in the Loch Ryan to Northern Ireland ferry route, and calls upon the Executive to match that commitment by announcing significant road improvement schemes for the A75 and A77 trunk routes to Stranraer. Supported by: David Mundell, Alasdair Morgan, Cathy Jamieson, Phil Gallie, Mr Adam Ingram, Christine Grahame, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Murray Tosh
S1M-209# South West Transport Links (lodged on 15 October 1999) Dr Elaine Murray*

S1M-209# Alex Fergusson: South West Transport Links—That the Parliament welcomes Stena Sealink’s recent decision to create 20 new jobs by substantially increasing its investment in the Loch Ryan to Northern Ireland ferry route, and calls upon the Executive to match that commitment by announcing significant road improvement schemes for the A75 and A77 trunk routes to Stranraer. Supported by: David Mundell, Alasdair Morgan, Cathy Jamieson, Phil Gallie, Mr Adam Ingram, Christine Grahame, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Murray Tosh, Dr Elaine Murray
S1M-209# South West Transport Links (lodged on 15 October 1999) Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-209# Alex Fergusson: South West Transport Links—That the Parliament welcomes Stena Sealink’s recent decision to create 20 new jobs by substantially increasing its investment in the Loch Ryan to Northern Ireland ferry route, and calls upon the Executive to match that commitment by announcing significant road improvement schemes for the A75 and A77 trunk routes to Stranraer. Supported by: David Mundell, Alasdair Morgan, Cathy Jamieson, Phil Gallie, Mr Adam Ingram, Christine Grahame, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Murray Tosh, Dr Elaine Murray, Mr Kenny MacAskill
